item.title: Automating Manjaro Setup with Ansible
item.description:
Overview

Setting up a fresh Linux installation can be a time-consuming and repetitive process. Every time you install Manjaro (or any Linux distribution), you face the same tedious tasks: installing your favorite applications, configuring your development environment, setting up tools, and tweaking system settings to match your preferences.

Enter Manjaro Playbook - an Ansible-based automation framework that transforms this multi-hour ordeal into a single command execution. This project represents the “infrastructure as code” philosophy applied to personal workstation configuration.

item.title: About
item.description:
Chirpy is a blog theme originally based on Jekyll. Due to Jekyll’s design limitations, it does not natively support internationalization (i18n) and requires third-party plugins for i18n functionality. To enable i18n support for Chirpy without the hassle of relying on third-party plugins, the hugo-theme-chirpy project migrated the Chirpy theme to Hugo with minimal adaptations. All features of Chirpy are available in hugo-theme-chirpy (though some functionalities may operate differently within the Hugo framework).

Follow the posts in the demo site to quickly set up a free personal blog!
